data.current_description: Retrieves all of the policies that exist on a particular resource.
data.summary_suggestion: List all policies for a folder resource
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves all organization policies that exist on a specified folder resource. Returns a list of GoogleCloudOrgpolicyV2Policy objects representing the policies currently applied to the folder. Supports pagination through optional parameters. Useful for auditing governance rules applied at the folder level.
data.reasoning: Missing summary entirely. Description lacks context about what policies are (governance rules), the resource type (folder), return type specificity, and pagination support. Added domain terminology ('organization policies', 'governance rules') and clarified the response structure for better AI agent understanding of when to use this operation.

message: Operation 'orgpolicy.folders.policies.create' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_context, missing_input_details. Missing summary entirely. Description focuses only on error cases without explaining the primary action or input requirements. Added context about the request schema (GoogleCloudOrgpolicyV2Policy), the successful response, domain terminology ('organization policy', 'governance rules', 'resource hierarchy'), and clarified the purpose for AI agents to understand when to invoke this operation.

data.current_description: Creates a policy. Returns a `google.rpc.Status` with `google.rpc.Code.NOT_FOUND` if the constraint does not exist. Returns a `google.rpc.Status` with `google.rpc.Code.ALREADY_EXISTS` if the policy already exists on the given Google Cloud resource.
data.summary_suggestion: Create a new organization policy for a folder
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new organization policy on a specified folder resource. Requires a GoogleCloudOrgpolicyV2Policy object in the request body defining the policy constraints and rules. Returns the created policy object on success. Returns a NOT_FOUND error if the referenced constraint does not exist. Returns an ALREADY_EXISTS error if a policy for the same constraint already exists on the folder. Policies enforce governance rules across the resource hierarchy.
data.reasoning: Missing summary entirely. Description focuses only on error cases without explaining the primary action or input requirements. Added context about the request schema (GoogleCloudOrgpolicyV2Policy), the successful response, domain terminology ('organization policy', 'governance rules', 'resource hierarchy'), and clarified the purpose for AI agents to understand when to invoke this operation.

message: Operation 'orgpolicy.folders.policies.delete' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_side_effects. Missing summary entirely. Description lacks clarity about what is being deleted (organization policy), which resource type (folder), and the side effect (constraints no longer enforced). Added input requirements, resource context, and side effects for AI agent clarity.

data.current_description: Deletes a policy. Returns a `google.rpc.Status` with `google.rpc.Code.NOT_FOUND` if the constraint or organization policy does not exist.
data.description_suggestion: Deletes an organization policy from a folder resource. The policy name must be provided in the request path. Returns a `google.rpc.Status` with `google.rpc.Code.NOT_FOUND` if the policy does not exist. After deletion, the policy constraints will no longer be enforced on the folder and its child resources.
data.reasoning: Missing summary entirely. Description lacks clarity about what is being deleted (organization policy), which resource type (folder), and the side effect (constraints no longer enforced). Added input requirements, resource context, and side effects for AI agent clarity.

message: Operation 'orgpolicy.folders.policies.get' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details. Missing summary. Description is vague about resource type (folder) and input requirements (policy name). Added clarity about resource context, input parameter, and the purpose of etag for AI agent understanding of when to use this operation.

data.current_description: Gets a policy on a resource. If no policy is set on the resource, `NOT_FOUND` is returned. The `etag` value can be used with `UpdatePolicy()` to update a policy during read-modify-write.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves an organization policy from a folder resource by name. Returns the policy object including its `etag` value, which is required for subsequent update operations. Returns `NOT_FOUND` if no policy exists on the specified folder. The `etag` enables optimistic concurrency control for read-modify-write operations.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description is vague about resource type (folder) and input requirements (policy name). Added clarity about resource context, input parameter, and the purpose of etag for AI agent understanding of when to use this operation.

message: Operation 'orgpolicy.folders.policies.patch' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, not_actionable. Missing summary. Description lacks clarity about resource type (folder), required inputs (policy name, etag), and what 'full overwrite' means in practice. Added context about concurrency control, input requirements, and side effects for better AI agent interpretability.

data.current_description: Updates a policy. Returns a `google.rpc.Status` with `google.rpc.Code.NOT_FOUND` if the constraint or the policy do not exist. Returns a `google.rpc.Status` with `google.rpc.Code.ABORTED` if the etag supplied in the request does not match the persisted etag of the policy Note: the supplied policy will perform a full overwrite of all fields.
data.description_suggestion: Updates an organization policy on a folder resource. Requires the policy name and a GoogleCloudOrgpolicyV2Policy object with the updated configuration. The request must include the current `etag` value for optimistic concurrency control; a mismatch returns `ABORTED`. Performs a full field overwrite - all policy fields in the request will replace existing values. Returns `NOT_FOUND` if the policy or constraint does not exist.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description lacks clarity about resource type (folder), required inputs (policy name, etag), and what 'full overwrite' means in practice. Added context about concurrency control, input requirements, and side effects for better AI agent interpretability.

message: Operation 'orgpolicy.folders.policies.getEffectivePolicy' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Missing summary. Description is unclear about what 'effective' means and lacks input/output clarity. Added explanation that this merges hierarchy policies, clarified that it's an aggregate result, and explained why certain fields are absent for AI agent understanding of when to use this versus regular get.

data.current_description: Gets the effective policy on a resource. This is the result of merging policies in the resource hierarchy and evaluating conditions. The returned policy will not have an `etag` or `condition` set because it is an evaluated policy across multiple resources. Subtrees of Resource Manager resource hierarchy with 'under:' prefix will not be expanded.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve effective organization policy for folder
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the effective organization policy for a folder by evaluating and merging all policies in the resource hierarchy above it. The returned policy reflects the combined constraints from parent resources and the folder itself, with conditions evaluated. Note: the returned policy omits `etag` and `condition` fields since it represents an evaluated aggregate policy. Resource Manager hierarchy subtrees with 'under:' prefix are not expanded in the result.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description is unclear about what 'effective' means and lacks input/output clarity. Added explanation that this merges hierarchy policies, clarified that it's an aggregate result, and explained why certain fields are absent for AI agent understanding of when to use this versus regular get.

data.current_description: Lists constraints that could be applied on the specified resource.
data.description_suggestion: Lists all organization policy constraints that can be applied to a folder resource. Constraints are filtered based on the folder's resource type and organization. Supports pagination via `pageSize` and `pageToken` parameters.

message: Operation 'orgpolicy.organizations.customConstraints.create' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Missing summary. data.current_description: Creates a custom constraint. Returns a `google.rpc.Status` with `google.rpc.Code.NOT_FOUND` if the organization does not exist. Returns a `google.rpc.Status` with `google.rpc.Code.ALREADY_EXISTS` if the constraint already exists on the given organization.
data.summary_suggestion: Create a custom organization policy constraint
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new custom constraint on an organization resource. Requires a GoogleCloudOrgpolicyV2CustomConstraint object specifying the constraint definition, resource types, and enforcement rules. Returns the created custom constraint object. Returns `NOT_FOUND` if the organization does not exist. Returns `ALREADY_EXISTS` if a constraint with the same name already exists on the organization. Custom constraints can then be used in policies applied to resources within the organization.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description lacks input details (what must be provided in the request body), output details (what is returned), and context about how custom constraints are used. Added request schema reference, response details, and relationship to policy enforcement for AI agent understanding.
